data.title: Members' Skydiving Records
data.meta_description: Members’ Skydiving Records Introduction This page does not claim to be a definitive compendium of British Skydiving Members’ Skydiving Records. The intention is that it will become more comprehensive over the years as it develops to become the British Skydiving online record book. World and European Continental Record claims must be made to the criteria […]
data.text:
Speed Skydiving British Record

Record date: 10 September 2015

Location: Skydive Teuge/Nationaal Paracentrum Teuge, Netherlands

Event: 2015 2nd FAI World Cup of Speed Skydiving and 1st FAI European Championships of Speed Skydiving

Record holder: Michael Lovemore

Record: British National Speed Skydiving Record – 504.09 km/h

This record was broken by the same record holder on 6 May 2016 (see entry for that date)

Congratulations to Mikey Lovemore who won double silver at the World Cup and European Championships in Speed Skydiving. His average speed of 498.23kph over four jumps is faster than the previous UK record for a single jump! He broke 500kph for the first time, one of only five people to ever do so in competition, and is now the 4th fastest speeder ever.

Wingsuit Performance Flying World, European & British Records

Records date: During the Wingsuit Performance Flying World Cup held from 25-29 May 2015

Event: 1st FAI Wingsuit Performance Flying World Cup

Location: Army Parachute Association, Netheravon, UK

Jackie Harper broke her own World, European and British Female Record for Time; and Spike Harper broke the British Record in Distance at on 12 September 2015 at the the British Nationals (see entry for that date).

Women’s 4-way Formation Skydiving World Record

Record date: 31 July 2005

Location: Target Skysports, Hibaldstow, NE Lincolnshire

Record score: 30 points / 35 secs

Camera: Andy Wright

Aircraft: Dornier GG2-HA-ACL

Pilot: Jan Wildgruber

Skydivers (all British FAI International Sporting Licence Holders): Team Airkix – Julia Foxwell, Emma Hammersley, Amanda Kemp, Clare ‘Sparky’ Scott

Congratulations to team Airkix (pictured) – Claire ‘Sparky’ Scott, Amanda Kemp, Emma Hammersley, Julia Foxwell and their camera flyer Andy Wright. They completed a women’s 4-way FS World Record sequence of 30 formations on one descent during Round 2 of the 4-way at the British Open Formation Skydiving Nationals on 31 July 2005 at Target Skysports, Hibaldstow
